org.jetel.data

Class RecordKey

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.RecordKey
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RecordOrderedKey

    public class RecordKey
extends java.lang.Object
    This class serves the role of DataRecords comparator.
    It can compare two records with different structure based on specified fields. It is used when sorting, hashing or (in general) comparing data.

    Usage:
    key = new RecordKey(keyFieldNames,recordMetadata);
    key.init();
    key.compare(recordA,recordB);
    Since:
    May 2, 2002

        Parameters:

        record2 - Description of the Parameter
        Returns:
        -1 ; 0 ; 1

      • compare

        public int compare(RecordKey secondKey,
          DataRecord record1,
          DataRecord record2)
        Compares two records (can have different layout) based on defined key-fields and returns (-1;0;1) if (< ; = ; >).
        The particular fields to be compared have to be of the same type !
        Parameters:
        secondKey - RecordKey defined for the second record
        record1 - First record
        record2 - Second record
        Returns:
        -1 ; 0 ; 1

      • isComparedNulls

        public boolean isComparedNulls()
        Deprecated. Temporary workaround until compareTo() will throw exception.
        Returns:
        true if equalNULLs == false and last call to compare(DataRecord, DataRecord) returned -1 because of comparison of two null valued fields.

      • generateKeyRecordMetadata

        public DataRecordMetadata generateKeyRecordMetadata()
        This method creates DataRecordMetadata object which represents fields composing this key. It can be used for creating data record composed from key fields only.
        Returns:
        DataRecordMetadata object

      • getFieldViolatingEquals

        public DataField getFieldViolatingEquals(DataRecord record1,
                                DataRecord record2)
        Utility method for identifying the first different data field.
        Parameters:
        record1 -
        record2 -
        Returns:
        First data field of record1 which causes that compare(record1, record2) does not return 0. Returns null in case that both records are equal or given records have different metadata!
